ygData.subject: Re: Getting my EQ fix any way I can (gee, this got real  long)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Some seem to.  My suicide run through Qeynos and again into the Freeport Militia house have both been unsuccessful even while invis.  However, I bind in
ygData.messageBody:
Jeremy Pollack wrote:

>
> 1) Do guards see invis? I wonder because I hope that now I can bind just
> inside oggok or grobb when in cazic (I hate that place) or guk (a little
> better) to avoid the long long run back from E Freeport.
>

Some seem to. My suicide run through Qeynos and again into the Freeport
Militia house have both been unsuccessful even while invis. However, I
bind in Surefall Glade occasionaly, and can make faces at those guards
and they never blink. Invis never works 100%, but it is still the
sweetest tool we have at level 30.

> 2) How long does feign death last? Indefinitely? Is it usable in combat
> situations? ie I am generally the only non-gater in my group. Does it cast
> quickly like shadow step so that I can cast it after taunting 5 mobs on me
> so my group can gate out of there? I know my girlfriend is looking forward
> to me getting feign death after I explained how it works because she started
> the game only recently but expects me to help her level. Hmmm. No Level no
> Lovin'? Heh.
>

First of all, don't DOT anything you plan on feigning. They will
continue to attack you, and by doing so, all the other enemies will
see through it as well. I have never seen it run out, it doesn't
put up a spell effect like invis, you just hit the sit button to stand
up, or meditate, or whatever. Also, you will want to practice the
feign pull, it is very handy and your groups will love you for
camp breaking.

> 3) About time we got a disease spell (Endure Disease). As someone else has
> said in the past ... it owuld really make sense for us to get CURE disease
> like necros. You should be able to undo anything that you can do.
>

I haven't had a bad disease in a while, but I hear Sol B has some
new ones to enjoy. I travel with a cleric. 'Nuff said.

No comment on the rest. I used my pet just teh other day to solo guards
and such, not bad when you get him behind the mobs, double attacking for
11-18 and bashing to boot. Of course I was giving him decent (not
rusty) weapons and always kept him behind them. So don't discount
them yet. They are great outdoors for soloing, probably doing 200
or so damage in combat. Not bad with Heat Blood and Engulfing going
at the same time. Throw in a fear and a blue is dead with less than
a bar of damage to you.

Xilith
